DOC.brief_summary: Safety and effectiveness of sinus balloon dilation in patients 2-21 years old.
DOC.brief_title: Sinus Balloon Dilation in Pediatric Patients
DOC.criteria: Patients age ≥ 2 to ≤ 21 years old. Diagnosed with Chronic Rhinosinusitis (CRS). Candidate for transnasal balloon sinus dilation. History of sinus surgery. Recent nasal or head and neck surgery. Fungal sinus disease. Severe asthma. Cystic fibrosis. Immunodeficiency. Craniofacial abnormalities. Pregnancy (current)
